User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - position: String

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>

3. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - longList: List<Player>
     - scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>

4. HeadScout
   - Attributes:
     - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>

5. Player
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - position: PlayerPosition
     - attributes: Map<String, String>

6. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
     - otherAttributes: Map<String, String>

7. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - scout: Scout
     - player: Player

8. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - pros: List<String>
     - cons: List<String>
     - recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

9. Director
   - Attributes:
     - officialOffers: List<Player>

### Attributes:
- Player
  - name: String
  - position: PlayerPosition
  - attributes: Map<String, String>

- PlayerProfile
  - targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>
  - otherAttributes: Map<String, String>

- ScoutingAssignment
  - scout: Scout
  - player: Player

- ScoutingReport
  - player: Player
  - pros: List<String>
  - cons: List<String>
  - recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the different designated target positions for a player to be scouted.
2. PlayerRecommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents the recommendations that can be made for a scouted player.

Classes:
1. Employee(name: String, position: String): Represents an employee of the club with a name and a position.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout who notes players in a long list and carries out scouting assignments.
4. HeadScout(scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents the head scout who evaluates scouting reports.
5. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<String, String>): Represents a player with a name, position, and other attributes.
6. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: Map<String, String>): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player): Represents a scouting assignment with a scout and a player.
8. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with player evaluation details.
9. Director(officialOffers: List<Player>): Represents the director who makes official offers for players.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. Recommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. Employee
   - Attributes: 
     - Name
     - Role

2. HeadCoach
   - Attributes: 
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of PlayerPosition)

3. Director
   - Attributes: 
     - Name

4. Scout
   - Attributes: 
     - LongList (List of Player)
     - ShortList (List of Player)
     - ScoutingReports (List of ScoutingReport)

5. Player
   - Attributes: 
     - Name
     - Attributes (List of PlayerAttribute)

6. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes: 
     - Player
     - Scout
     - CompletionStatus

7. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes: 
     - Player
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (Recommendation)

8. DirectorOffer
   - Attributes: 
     - Player
     - OfferStatus

### Attributes:
1. PlayerAttribute
   - Name
   - Value

2. CompletionStatus
   - Ongoing
   - Completed

3. OfferStatus
   - Pending
   - Accepted
   - Rejected

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the various designated target positions for a player.

2. Recommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Represents the recommendations given for a player after scouting.

### Classes:
1. Employee(Name: string, Role: string): Represents the basic information of an employee in the club.

2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.

3. Director(Name: string): Represents the director of the club.

4. Scout(LongList: List<Player>, ShortList: List<Player>, ScoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout who maintains long and short player lists and scouting reports.

5. Player(Name: string, Attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with various attributes.

6. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, Scout: Scout, CompletionStatus: CompletionStatus): Represents a scouting assignment for a player.

7. ScoutingReport(Player: Player, Pros: string, Cons: string, Recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.

8. DirectorOffer(Player: Player, OfferStatus: OfferStatus): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

### Attributes:
1. PlayerAttribute(Name: string, Value: string): Represents an attribute with a name and value for a player.

2. CompletionStatus(Ongoing, Completed): Represents the status of completion for a scouting assignment.

3. OfferStatus(Pending, Accepted, Rejected): Represents the status of an offer made by the director.

The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

1. PlayerPosition {GK, LB, CB, RB, LWB, RWB, CDM, CM, CAM, LM, RM, LW, RW, CF, ST}
2. PlayerRecommendation {KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning}

### Classes:
1. **TeamSportsScoutingSystem**
   - Attributes:
     - employees: List<Employee>
     - designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>
     - scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>
     - shortListedPlayers: List<Player>

2. **Employee**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - role: Role

3. **PlayerProfile**
   - Attributes:
     - targetPosition: PlayerPosition
     - playerAttributes: Map<String, String>

4. **ScoutingReport**
   - Attributes:
     - player: Player
     - pros: String
     - cons: String
     - recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

5. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - name: String
     - position: PlayerPosition

6. **Director**
   - Inherits from Employee

7. **Scout**
   - Inherits from Employee

8. **HeadCoach**
   - Inherits from Employee

### Attributes:
- Employee:
  - name: String
  - role: Role

- PlayerProfile:
  - targetPosition: PlayerPosition
  - playerAttributes: Map<String, String>

- ScoutingReport:
  - player: Player
  - pros: String
  - cons: String
  - recommendation: PlayerRecommendation

- Player:
  - name: String
  - position: PlayerPosition

- Director:
  - Inherits from Employee

- Scout:
  - Inherits from Employee

- HeadCoach:
  - Inherits from Employee

2. PlayerRecommendation {KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ReserveTeamPlayer, ProspectivePlayer, NotAGoodSigning}: Represents different recommendations for a scouted player.

Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>, designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>, shortListedPlayers: List<Player>): Represents the system used for scouting players in a sports club.
2. Employee(name: String, role: Role): Represents an employee in the sports club with a name and role.
3. PlayerProfile(targetPosition: PlayerPosition, playerAttributes: Map<String, String>): Represents a player profile with a target position and player attributes.
4. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player including pros, cons, and recommendation.
5. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition): Represents a player with a name and position.
6. Director(name: String, role: Role): Represents the director of the sports club.
7. Scout(name: String, role: Role): Represents a scout in the sports club.
8. HeadCoach(name: String, role: Role): Represents the head coach of the sports club.

2. Recommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Indicates the recommendation status for a player.

Classes:
1. Employee(id: int, name: String): Represents an employee in the club with an identifier and a name.
2. Player(id: int, name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<String, String>): Represents a player with an identifier, name, position, and additional attributes.
3. Scout(assignedPlayers: List<Player>): Represents a scout with a list of assigned players to scout.
4. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment with a scout, player, and scouting report.
5. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
6. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>): Represents the head coach with a list of designated player profiles.
7. HeadScout(scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the head scout with a list of scouting assignments.
8. Director(officialOffers: List<Player>): Represents the director with a list of official offers.

The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. 1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - CB (Center Back)
   - RB (Right Back)
   - CDM (Central Defensive Midfielder)
   - CM (Central Midfielder)
   - RM (Right Midfielder)
   - LM (Left Midfielder)
   - RW (Right Winger)
   - LW (Left Winger)
   - ST (Striker)

2. Recommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player

   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

AI:**Enumerations:**
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, RM, LM, RW, LW, ST):Represents the designated target positions for a player to be scouted.
2. Recommendation(Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing):Provides a recommendation for a player based on scouting reports.

**Classes:**
1. ClubEmployee(name: String, position: String):Represents an employee of the club with a name and position.
2. HeadCoach(assignedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>):Represents the head coach with assigned player profiles for future signings.
3. Director():Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>):Represents a scout with a list of potential player matches.
5. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<String, String>):Represents a player with a name, position, and other attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport):Represents a scouting assignment with a scout, player, and scouting report.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation):Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
8. ShortList(players: List<Player>):Represents a shortlist of players for further evaluation.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player):Represents an official offer for a player.

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:**Enumerations:**
1. PlayerPosition - GK (Goalkeeper), LB (Left Back), etc.
2. Recommendation - Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing

**Classes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
2. Employee
3. HeadCoach
4. Director
5. Scout
6. Player
7. ScoutingAssignment
8. ScoutingReport
9. ShortList
10. Offer

**Attributes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - employees (list of Employee)
   - shortLists (list of ShortList)
   
2. Employee
   - id
   - name
   - role
   
3. HeadCoach
   - designatedPlayerProfiles (list of PlayerPosition)
   
4. Director
   - officialOffers (list of Offer)
   
5. Scout
   - scoutingReports (list of ScoutingReport)
   
6. Player
   - name
   - attributes (map of attribute name to value)
   
7. ScoutingAssignment
   - scout
   - player
   - evaluation
   
8. ScoutingReport
   - pros
   - cons
   - recommendation
   
9. ShortList
   - players (list of Player)
   
10. Offer
    - player
    - status

AI:**Enumerations:**
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, etc.): Used to specify designated target positions for players for scouting purposes.
2. Recommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Used to provide a recommendation on a player after scouting.

**Classes:**
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: list of Employee, shortLists: list of ShortList): Represents the overall system used by the club for scouting players.
2. Employee(id: int, name: string, role: string): Represents an employee of the club involved in the scouting process.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: list of PlayerPosition): Represents the head coach responsible for identifying player profiles for signings.
4. Director(officialOffers: list of Offer): Represents the director of the club who makes official offers for players.
5. Scout(scoutingReports: list of ScoutingReport): Represents a scout who submits scouting reports on players.
6. Player(name: string, attributes: map of attribute name to value): Represents a player with various attributes.
7. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player, evaluation: string): Represents a scouting assignment for a player with evaluation.
8. ScoutingReport(pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report on a player with pros, cons, and recommendation.
9. ShortList(players: list of Player): Represents a list of players moved to the shortlist for further evaluation.
10. Offer(player: Player, status: string): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:

### Classes:
1. Employee(role: String):Represents an employee with a specific role in the club.
2. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<Player>):Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director(scoutingAssignment: ScoutingAssignment):Represents the director of the club responsible for scouting assignments.
4. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport):Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting reports.
5. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: Map<String, Object>):Represents a player with a name, position, and various attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Scout, player: Player):Represents a scouting assignment assigned to a scout for a specific player.
7. ScoutingReport(pros: String, cons: String, recommendation: Recommendation):Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation for a player.
8. ShortList(player: List<Player>):Represents a short list of players selected for further evaluation.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player):Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.
